articles.author: JAKE OFFENHARTZ and JENNIFER PELTZ
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — The man accused of killing UnitedHealthcare's CEO has been charged with murder as an act of terrorism, prosecutors said Tuesday as they worked to bring him to a New York court from a Pennsylvania jail.
articles.title: Suspect charged with killing UnitedHealthcare's CEO as an act of terrorism

articles.author: DEVI SHASTRI and SCOTT BAUER
articles.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — The motive for a shooting that killed a teacher and a student and wounded others at a Wisconsin school appears to be a “combination of factors,” a police chief said Tuesday as he appealed to the public to share what they might know about the 15-year-old girl who attacked a study hall before shooting herself.
articles.title: Police chief says motive for Wisconsin school shooting was a 'combination of factors'

articles.author: LOLITA C. BALDOR
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A couple hundred North Korean troops fighting alongside Russian forces against Ukraine have been killed or wounded during battle in the Kursk border region, a senior military official said Tuesday.
articles.title: A couple hundred North Korean troops killed, wounded in battles with Ukrainian forces

articles.author: KEVIN FREKING
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Congressional leaders have unveiled a stopgap spending bill that will keep the federal government funded through March 14 and provide more than $100 billion in emergency aid to help states and local communities recover from Hurricanes Helene and Milton and other natural disasters.
articles.title: Congress unveils funding deal with more than $100 billion in disaster aid

articles.author: ELAINE KURTENBACH
articles.description: BANGKOK (AP) — Japanese automakers Nissan Motor Corp. and Honda Motor Co. confirmed Wednesday that they are discussing closer collaboration but denied reports they have decided on a merger. Nissan’s share price soared more than 22% in Tokyo after reports citing unnamed sources said it might merge with Honda to form the world’s third-largest automaking group.
articles.title: Nissan, Honda confirm talks on closer collaboration but say there's been no decision on a merger

articles.author: MARTHA BELLISLE
articles.description: The secretary general of the International Biathlon Union apologized to any athlete who was mistreated during his tenure at U.S. Biathlon while speaking to a 90-minute meeting Tuesday that focused on concerns about athlete safety brought to light by multiple Associated Press reports.
articles.title: Biathlon official apologizes to athletes who have suffered mistreatment

articles.author: SOPHIA TAREEN and RICK CALLAHAN
articles.description: MICHIGAN CITY, Ind. (AP) — An Indiana man convicted in the 1997 killings of his brother and three other men was set to receive a lethal injection by early Wednesday in the state's first execution in 15 years, without any independent witness present under the state's laws shielding information about the death penalty.
articles.title: Man who killed brother and 3 others set to be put to death in Indiana's first execution in 15 years

articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Rayful Edmond, a drug kingpin once believed to control about a third of the cocaine trade in the nation’s capital during the crack epidemic of the 1980s, has died in federal custody, the Bureau of Prisons confirmed Tuesday.
articles.title: Rayful Edmond, notorious DC drug kingpin, dies in federal custody at 60

articles.author: DAVID BAUDER
articles.description: President-elect Donald Trump sued the Des Moines Register and its pollster for “brazen election interference” in publishing a survey the weekend before the election that showed Democrat Kamala Harris with a surprising lead of three percentage points in the state.
articles.title: Trump sues Des Moines Register, pollster for 'election interference' after pre-election poll

articles.author: MELANIE LIDMAN
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Tuesday that Israeli forces will stay in a buffer zone on the Syrian border, seized after the ouster of Syria's President Bashar Assad, until another arrangement is in place “that ensures Israel's security.”
articles.title: Netanyahu says Israeli troops will occupy a buffer zone inside Syria for the foreseeable future
